basic_info.description: I'm a Ph.D. student working at the Computatiaonl Interaction Lab, Saarland University. My current research interest is mainly focused in analyzing and predicting user's fixations when interacting with interface. Before moving to the Germany, I also have few research experience in huamn reliability analysis and data visualization.

projects.title: Human Reliability Analyses based on Cognitive Motivation Model
projects.description: Conducting a simulation to model the impact of motivation intensity on human performance with artificial neural network. Leading a team of four students in designing and conducting simulated experiment on aircraft approaching process. Examining statistical analyses of different influencing factors on human performance; techniques used includes ANOVA, regression analysis, and smoothing with curve fitting.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!

education.location: St. Louis, United States of America
education.title: Master Student, Data Analytics & Statistics
